formalpara.title: Figure 3. Acute ethanol tolerance in C. elegans varies between two wild strains.
formalpara.para: (A) The relative speed (% of the speed of untreated animals) of three strains increases during a continuous exposure to exogenous ethanol (500 mM). The wild strain, CB4856 and a CB4856-derived strain that had been outcrossed seven times to the N2 strain, and selected for a rapid development of acute tolerance at each outcross, demonstrate more rapid recovery of speed (acute tolerance), particularly in the 10–30 minute interval than does the N2 wild strain. Error bars, s.e.m. (B) C. elegans has low permeability to exogenous ethanol. The internal ethanol concentration (mM) within the two wild strains, N2 and CB4856, at the 10-, 30 and 50 minute time points remains constant but CB4856 demonstrated higher internal ethanol concentrations than N2.
